place_of_publication.publication_title: Mem. Amer. Acad. Arts, n. s.

bio:treatment.description: Plants large, plumose, green, yellow-green, or brownish. Stems 10–25(–45) cm, sympodial branching rare, branches 6–10(–12) mm, almost always simple. Stem leaves 1.2–2.2 × 0.8–1.2(–1.6) mm; laminal cells 35–80 × 3–5(–6) µm. Branch leaves distinctly plicate, 1–2 × (0.6–)0.7–0.9(–1.2) mm. Seta 1.5–2 cm. Spores 12–16 µm.
litter soil rich in humus rotten logs forests mesic diffusely lighted places

verbatim.text: Litter, soil rich in humus, rotten logs, forests, mesic, diffusely lighted places; low to moderate elevations (0-1300 m); B.C.; Alaska, Calif., Idaho, Mont., Oreg., Wash.

parsed.habitat: Litter, soil rich in humus, rotten logs, forests, mesic, diffusely lighted places;
parsed.distribution: B.C.; Alaska, Calif., Idaho, Mont., Oreg., Wash.

bio:treatment.discussion: Kindbergia oregana differs from the most common morphotype of K. praelonga in its more robust stature and simple branches. In addition, the branch leaves of K. oregana are usually distinctly plicate and the laminal cells are narrower and more thin-walled.
